thread.title: Port Barre blanks Pine Prairie for first district win
thread.title_full: Port Barre blanks Pine Prairie for first district win

title: Port Barre blanks Pine Prairie for first district win
text:
Port Barre blanks Pine Prairie for first district win Bobby Ardoin 5:33 p.m. CDT October 24, 2015 1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Port Barre High defense sustained its effectiveness Friday night as the Red Devils’ offense found a spark. 
Port Barre held an opponent to a touchdown or less for the third time this season as the Devils ended a two-game district losing streak with a 28-0 win over Pine Prairie. 
The win enabled the Devils to climb to 5-3 overall and 2-1 in District 5-3A. 
Pine Prairie (3-5) lost a third straight game after starting 5-3A 3-2. 
Port Barre also discovered some offense. The Devils rushed for 250 yards. 
That effort complemented the Port Barre defense, which limited Pine Prairie to 154 total yards. The Panthers failed to complete any of their seven passes and had a pair of throws intercepted. 
PBHS head football coach Mac Mistric said the Devils were able to combine several positive elements, which had prevented the Devils from winning their last two games. 
“We’ve now gone a bunch of minutes without allowing a touchdown. Offensively we didn’t have the turnovers that we’ve had recently. In our practices last week we really emphasized protecting the ball. 
“What we saw (against Pine Prairie) was a complete role reversal of what we saw the past couple of weeks,” Mistric said. 
The Devils limited Pine Prairie quarterback Dylan Doucet to 90 yards. Douglas Fontenot, the Panthers’ other backfield threat, gained 24 on 10 carries. 
Mistric said his team didn’t devise any special defenses that limited Pine Prairie. 
“There was nothing particular about what we did. We just tried to slow them (Doucet and Fontenot) down. We played our normal defense and with did a good job with that. 
“One of our linebackers, Matt Leger, injured his hand in practice last week, but he put a cast on it and came out there with a big club-looking thing and made 12 solo tackles,” said Mistric. 
Leger also had one of the Devils’ pass interceptions. Alex Olivier had the other pick off. 
Offensively Port Barre received a 144-yard offensive performance from running back J.J. Sylvester, who also scored twice. 
Mistric said Sylvester’s return to the lineup after missing most of the last two games, was beneficial to an offense that had difficulties in last Friday night’s 6-0 overtime loss to Ville Platte. 
“(Sylvester) played three quarters (against Pine Prairie). He’s been a big part of our offense and we seem to play with more confidence when he is in the game,” said Mistric. 
The first quarter ended scoreless, but in the second period the Devils scored early when Sylvester broke loose on a 26-yard run (11:52). 
A Terrance Lemelle two-point conversion run gave Port Barre an 8-0 lead. 
Sylvester scored on a one-yard run later in the period (4:36). The extra point kick attempt failed and the Devils brought a 14-0 lead into the halftime dressing room. 
Port Barre scored on the first offensive series of the third period when Sylvester bolted over on a one-yard run. 
Lanclos ended the scoring in the fourth period when he thew an 11-yard pass to Spencer Brace (5:41). 
The Devils finished with 250 rushing yards. 
NEXT WEEK: Port Barre goes to Eunice for a 5-3A game. Pine Prairie is also involved in a league game when the Panthers go to Ville Platte. 1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://www.dailyworld.com/story/sports/high-school/2015/10/24/port-barre-blanks-pine-prairie-first-district-win/74552696/ TOP VIDEOS
